intro: Paepalanthus cabralensis, commonly known as the Cabral's puya, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae, which includes plants adapted to arid and high-altitude environments. The plant is characterized by its rosette of narrow, fleshy leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in a dense inflorescence. It is a perennial herb that thrives in rocky soils and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
